decision_description: Fair Trading Act charges over representations about home loan interest changes and overcharging.
impact_summary: Kiwibank allegedly misled customers and overcharged interest; the bank is addressing issues.
estimation_basis: ComCom said 'more than 36,000' customers were affected.

decision_description: Bank discovered and remediated fee waiver not applied correctly to joint accounts.
impact_summary: Refunds and interest paid to affected customers; systems updated.
estimation_basis: Kiwibank said 8,663 customers were affected and ~$2.07m refunded.

decision_description: Unreasonable default fees and non-compliance with lender responsibility obligations.
impact_summary: Court found TSB charged unreasonable fees; remediation and penalties followed.
estimation_basis: ComCom media release references 48k affected; court summary cites ~42k overcharged—range used.

entities: ANZ; Financial Markets Authority; High Court
decision_description: Misleading representations and charging for ineligible/duplicate Credit Card Repayment Insurance (CCRI).
impact_summary: High Court ordered civil penalty; refunds to affected customers.
estimation_basis: FMA/Consumer NZ report noted 307 affected customers and $280k penalty.

entities: ANZ; ASB; Westpac; Commerce Commission; FMA
decision_description: Misleading marketing/sale of interest rate swaps to farmers; settlements reached.
impact_summary: Nearly $25.5m paid to eligible customers and rural charities; ~253 farmers affected.
estimation_basis: NZ Herald reported 253 affected farmers; ComCom/FMA settlement totals published.

entities: Latitude Financial; NZTA; Privacy regulators (NZ & AU)
decision_description: Massive cyber-attack and data breach including NZ driver licence data.
ethical_theme: Privacy; Data Minimisation; Security; Duty of Care
impact_summary: Stolen IDs created identity theft risks; licence replacements offered; regulators investigating.
estimation_basis: 1News confirmed 1,037,000 NZ licence numbers compromised; 14,925 full images; Latitude updates.

entities: Banking Ombudsman Scheme; [bank name withheld in case note]
decision_description: Customer’s card details were stolen and misused; bank reimbursed $80,000.
impact_summary: Bank accepted responsibility for its mistakes and reimbursed significant losses.
estimation_basis: Single case note; one consumer involved.

entities: Banking Ombudsman Scheme; [bank name withheld in case note]
decision_description: Authorised payment scam—customer approved payment after warnings; no reimbursement.
impact_summary: Ombudsman found bank had warned the customer appropriately; loss not compensated.
estimation_basis: Single case note; one consumer involved.

decision_description: Unreasonable loan establishment ('platform') fees charged to borrowers; $7m refunds.
impact_summary: Borrowers overcharged over several years; refunds and fee cap implemented.
estimation_basis: Consumer NZ and RNZ report ~37,000 borrowers to be compensated.

decision_description: Default provider reforms: lower fees, balanced risk, exclusion of fossil fuels.
impact_summary: Changes affect default members through fee cuts and ethical exclusions.
estimation_basis: MBIE said about 381,000 members were in default funds when settings changed in 2021.

decision_description: Industry anti‑scam commitments incl. Confirmation of Payee and reimbursement standards.
impact_summary: System changes aim to prevent misdirected payments and scams across participating banks.
est_people_affected: 949+ known scam disputes/year; potential user base = millions of bank customers
estimation_basis: Banking Ombudsman 2023/24: 949 scam-related disputes; NZBA says all major retail banks rolling out protections, covering most NZ bank customers.

entities: Commerce Commission; MBIE; Visa; Mastercard; NZ Government
decision_description: Interchange fee caps and (proposed) ban on most in‑store card surcharges to lower costs.
ethical_theme: Consumer welfare; Fair pricing; Inclusion (small merchants)
impact_summary: Lower merchant costs expected to reduce prices/surcharges; broad impact on card users.
estimation_basis: MBIE estimated $74m annual savings from initial caps (2022). Reuters (2025) cites $150m consumer surcharge savings proposal; majority of adults use cards.

entities: MBIE; Parliament (Customer and Product Data Act 2025)
decision_description: Customer & Product Data Act (NZ’s Consumer Data Right) enabling data sharing starting with banking.
ethical_theme: Autonomy; Data portability; Competition; Privacy safeguards
impact_summary: Will let customers permission third parties to access bank data to get better deals/services.
estimation_basis: Act passed in 2025; banking designated first—covers customers of major banks (majority of NZ adults).
